text:
Let's talk about how to help
chief marketing officers

(CMOs) increase market
return on investment (ROI)

from three core areas with the
cloud.

First, you want to increase
advertising-spend

effectiveness, get a unified
view of customer behavior,

and use in-house advertising
technology.

You can do this by implementing
a customer data platform,

developing a real-time
advertising analytics platform,

creating a centralized
marketing data lake, and running

an in-house demand-side and bidding
platform.

For example, Coca-Cola
migrated their digital marketing

systems to Amazon Web Services
(AWS) and reduced costs by 40
percent.

To increase direct-to-consumer
acquisition and lifetime

values, personalize
the customer journey and campaigns

across channels at scale by dynamically
creating campaigns, segments,
and personalized messages.

Machine learning (ML) can be applied
across consumer devices and platforms

to create a consistent,
personalized customer experience

while ensuring your business
is protected against fraud.

You can also create connected
products with analytics,

and run an omnichannel
contact center in the cloud.

For example, Subway built a recommendation
engine for restaurant

guests on AWS without requiring
them to have any internal ML expertise.

Finally, time to market is crucial
in todayâ€™s landscape,

and marketing agility is a key
piece of that.

Accelerate marketing agility
by unifying analytics across

the marketing stack by streamlining
platform integrations,

data partnerships,
and sourcing.

There are several mechanisms
that can help you get started
with this process.

You can integrate
marketing technology partners

by setting up customer-360
and social-analytics

platforms that easily integrate
with cloud-based ML and analytics systems.

Or you could integrate
omnichannel marketing automation

tools with cloud ML and 360-degree
analytics.
